page.title: 11GOVERNMENT
page.content: Meonstoke has had its Parish Council since 1894.Corhampton and Meonstoke, originally separate parishes, were made into one civil parish in 1932. It has 7 Parish Councillors,from whom a chairman is elected annually.The number of councillors is relative to the number of residents in the parish (600). Exton has remained separate having an annual parish meeting to decide on its parish rate. The three villages come under the jurisdiction of the Winchester City District Council (Upper Meon Valley Ward) and Hampshire County Council having one councillor to represent them on each council.
